RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui dotourado (2012) em Fsica Estatstica pela Escola Internacional de Estudos Avanados de Trieste (SISSA) na Itlia. Durante os anos 2012-2014, trabalhou como pesquisador ps-doutor do Centre National de Recherche Scientifique (CNRS) na Ecole Normale Superieure de Paris. Completou um segundo ps-doutorado (2014-2016) no Instituto Max Planck para a Fsica dos Sistemas Complexos (MPIPKS) em Dresden. Atualmente professor adjunto de matemtica da ECT-UFRN e, desde o 2017, tambm um dos pesquisadores lderes do Instituto Internacional de Fsica (IIF) em Natal. Tem experincia em Fsica Esttistica com particular enfse em: Teora conforme dos campos e fenmenos crticos, Modlos integrveis, Dinmica e emaranhamento em sistemas qunticos com muitas partculas, Modlos de rede clssicos bidimensionais.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: I am a theoretical physicist specialized in Statistical Field Theory.&#10;I earned my PhD form the International Institute of Advances Studies (SISSA) of Trieste in Italy in 2012 where I worked on quantum field theories applied to statistical mechanics. In the years 2012-2014, I was employed as a post-doctoral researcher by the Laboratoire de Physique Theorique (LPT) de l'Ecole Normale Superieure in Paris. Finally, in 2014-2016, I completed a second post-doc at the Max Planck Institute for the Physics of Complex Systems (MPIPKS) in Dresden (Germany). Since February 2016 I am assistant professor (Professor Adjunto) at the Federal University of Rio Grande do Norte (UFRN). From August 2017 I am also Research Leader in Statistical Physics at the International Institute of Physics (IIP) of Natal (Brazil). My research activity is focused on: Conformal Field Theory, Integrable Models and Field Theories, Quantum Dynamics and Entanglement in low dimensional systems, Classical lattice models of 2d Statistical Mechanics.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES: Ele obteve a &quot;Qualification&quot; para Maitre de conference pelo ministerio da Educacao frances em 2013.
